comment.body: It serves it's purpose to offer a different frame on politics.

@meidan: I am so conflicted when it comes to digesting and politics overall. First of all take the digestion of politics, it usually ends up with users consuming news that is aligned with their current position or one they see as favorable. Unless they are in a transition phase.

My problem with politics, is I can't find a definite position, so I can't find the ultimate good. I can only find positions that support my interests, and often as in nature it comes at the expense of others. Does everybody's politics just favor their own interest or is their a higher purpose? An ultimate good? A side of politics that can be as certain as Algebra?

@meidan:  Good for you you won't die stupid. I find that I learn more reading an hour essay from the old times then reading the INTERNET for 3 days. The thing is those old essays are so heavy to digest. We really have gotten dumber. Maybe because the old guys didn't have so many distractions they could actually do useful thinking.
Spam is part of the price for freedom.

I am getting a 404 error, but Westworld I don't like it much. I like it and hate it. It seems like a modern PC bullshit take on the wildwest, and my biggest problem is that, they don't spend enough time dwelling in characters. They just gloss over them. You don't really get to "know" any of them.

What do you think?
@KosherX:  lol same here. What politics do you currently hold and believe in?
KosherX: Don't leave me - Jacques Brel https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0k63grkip5I

@Scrub: Considering the wikileak revelations, surprising to not hear more about his subverted candidacy from the mainstream and verified accounts on Twitter. This should be a huge talking point, for anyone who is #nevertrump as it nullified a huge part of the electoral process.
